sen.j: 西川寅吉（にしかわとらきち、1854年 - 1941年）は、日本において過去に脱獄を最も多く行った事で知られた、いわゆる脱獄魔。
sen.e: Torakichi NISHIKAWA (1854 - 1941) was a so-called escape artist, who registered the largest number of prison breakings in the history of Japan.
Torakichi NISHIKAWA (1854 - 1941) was a so-called escape artist, who registered the largest number of prison breaks in the history of Japan.
Torakichi NISHIKAWA (1854 - 1941) was a so-called escape artist, who registered the largest number of prison breaks in the history of Japan.

sen.j: 後述するエピソードから五寸釘寅吉（ごすんくぎとらきち、五寸釘の寅吉）の異名を取り、その名のほうが人口には膾炙している。
sen.e: Based on the episode below, he was also called by another name, Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail), and this pseudonym was more popular among the people.
sen.cmt: 五寸釘寅吉（ごすんくぎとらきち、五寸釘の寅吉）→定訳不明：Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail) としました。
sen.e: Based on the episode below, he was also called by another name, Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail), and this pseudonym has been more popular among the people.
sen.cmt: was→has been と修正しました。
sen.e: Based on the episode below, he was also called by another name, Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail), and this pseudonym has been more popular among the people.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 西川は安政元年（1854年）、現在の三重県多気郡明和町 (三重県)に農家の次男として生まれた。
sen.e: Nishikawa was born in 1854 as the second son of a farm family in Meiwa-cho, Taki-gun, Mie Prefecture
Nishikawa was born in 1854, as the second son of a farm family in present Meiwa-cho, Taki-gun, Mie Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「現在の」を補いました。カンマ、ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: Nishikawa was born in 1854, as the second son of a farm family in present Meiwa-cho, Taki-gun, Mie Prefecture.

sen.j: 生まれながらに人並みを外れた運動能力を持っていたと伝わっている。
sen.e: It is said that he had an outstanding capability of movement by nature.
It is said that he had an outstanding movement capability by nature.
sen.cmt: capability of movement→movement capability と修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that he had an outstanding movement capability by nature.

sen.j: 西川が最初に犯罪を犯し牢獄に入ることとなったのはわずか14歳の時である。
sen.e: When he was only 14 years old, he committed the fist crime and imprisoned.
He was only 14 years old, when he committed the fist crime and imprisoned.
He was only 14 years old, when he committed the fist crime and imprisoned.

sen.j: 西川をかわいがっていたという叔父が博打の揉め事で殺された。
sen.e: His uncle, who is said to have devoted a lot of attention to Nishikawa, was killed in a trouble of gamble.
His uncle, who is said to have adored Nishikawa, was killed in a gambling dispute.
sen.cmt: devoted a lot of attention→adored, trouble of gamble→gambling dispute と修正しました。
sen.e: His uncle, who is said to have adored Nishikawa, was killed in a gambling dispute.

sen.j: その仇討ちとして叔父を殺した人物に刀を振るい、さらにその人物の家に火を放ったのである。
sen.e: Then, to avenge his uncle, he wielded the blade to the person who killed his uncle, and moreover, he set fire to this person's house.
Then, to avenge, he wielded the blade to the person who killed his uncle, and moreover, he set fire to this person's house.
sen.cmt: avenge his uncle→avenge と修正しました。
sen.e: Then, to avenge, he wielded the blade to the person who killed his uncle, and moreover, he set fire to this person's house.

sen.j: 無期懲役の刑を受け、西川は地元三重の牢獄に服すこととなった。
sen.e: Nishikawa was sentenced to life in prison with work, and he was sent to the prison his local erea in Mie Prefecture.
Nishikawa was sentenced to life in prison with work, and he was sent to the prison in his local Mie Prefecture.
sen.cmt: with work を削除しました。his local erea in→in his local と修正しました。
sen.e: Nishikawa was sentenced to life in prison with work, and he was sent to the prison in his local Mie Prefecture.

sen.j: まだ若く、またその犯した罪があだ討ちとあって牢獄では受刑者たちにかわいがられていた。
sen.e: As he was still young and the crime he committed was a vengeance, inmates took care of him in the prison.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As he was still young and the crime he committed was a vengeance, inmates took care of him in the prison.
As he was still young and the crime he committed was a vengeance, inmates took care of him in the prison.

sen.j: が、仇となる人物が生きていることが分かったため、西川は受刑者たちの助けを借りて脱獄。
sen.e: However, he came to know that the enemy was still alive, he escaped from the prison with the help of inmates.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, he came to know that the enemy was still alive; he escaped from the prison with the help of the prisoners.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 パンクチュエーションを修正しました。inmates→prisoners と修正しました。
sen.e: However, he came to know that the enemy was still alive; he escaped from the prison with the help of the prisoners.

sen.j: その後肝心のあだ討ちがならぬうちに再び三重の牢獄に収容されたが、またもや受刑者たちの力を借りて脱獄した。
sen.e: After that, he was caught and locked up again in the same prison of Mie, before having achieved his essential purpose of avenging his uncle, but Nishikawa again broke out of the prison, helped by inmates.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。肝心のあだ討ち→his essential purpose of avenging his uncleとしました。
sen.e: After that, he was caught and locked up again in the same prison of Mie before having achieved his essential purpose of avenging his uncle, but Nishikawa again broke out of the prison, helped by inmates.
sen.cmt: カンマを修正しました。
sen.e: After that, he was caught and locked up again in the same prison of Mie before having achieved his essential purpose of avenging his uncle, but Nishikawa again broke out of the prison, helped by inmates.

sen.j: そして一角の賭博師として全国の賭場を渡り歩いたがまた捕まって、次には秋田市の集治監に入れられたがさらにまた脱走した。
sen.e: He wandered around all over the country as a consummate gambler, but unfortunately he happened to be captured and this time he was sent to Shujikan (former type of state-run prison existed during the Meiji period for the prisoners sentenced a severe punishment) in Akita City, from which he escaped though.
He wandered around all over the country as a consummate gambler, but was captured again, and this time he was sent to Shujikan (prison) in Akita City, from which he escaped once more.
sen.cmt: unfortunately he happened to be→was captured again,カッコ内を修正しました。カンマを補いました。though→once more と修正しました。
sen.e: He wandered around all over the country as a consummate gambler, but was captured again, and this time he was sent to Shujikan (prison) in Akita City, from which he escaped once more.

sen.j: 西川の体力には並外れたものがあった。
sen.e: Nishikawa had an extraordinary physical strength.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Nishikawa had an extraordinary physical strength.
Nishikawa had an extraordinary physical strength.

sen.j: 秋田から故郷の三重へ向けて逃げている途中の静岡県で博打に関わる揉め事に巻き込まれた挙句、警察に追われる羽目となった。
sen.e: On the way of escape from Akita Prefecture to his hometown in Mie Prefecture, he was involved in a hassles related to gambling in Shizuoka Prefecture and the things came to such a pass that he had to elude the chase of the police.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On the way of escape from Akita Prefecture to his hometown Mie Prefecture, he was involved in a dispute related to gambling in Shizuoka Prefecture, and he ended up with being chased by police.
sen.cmt: in を削除しました。hassles→dispute,文の後半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: On the way of escape from Akita Prefecture to his hometown Mie Prefecture, he was involved in a dispute related to gambling in Shizuoka Prefecture, and he ended up with being chased by police.

sen.j: そのとき五寸釘の刺さった板を足で踏んだが、そのままついに捕まるまで十数キロ逃げたという伝説が生まれ、それが五寸釘寅吉の名の元となった。
sen.e: According to a legend resulted from this runaway, at that time he stepped on a Gosun-kugi long nail stuck in a board, he continued running away in a distance of until he was finally arrested, and since then, the people began calling him Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail) was born..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。五寸釘寅吉→Gosun-kugi long nail五寸釘寅吉→定訳不明：Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail) としました。
sen.e: A legend was created from this runaway: he stepped on a Gosun-kugi long nail stuck in a board, but he continued running away for over 10 kilometers until he was finally arrested; then this became the origin of the name of Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail).
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じてスムースに適宜修正しました。「十数キロ」を補い修正しました。
sen.e: A legend was created from this runaway: he stepped on a Gosun-kugi long nail stuck in a board, but he continued running away for over 10 kilometers until he was finally arrested; then this became the origin of the name of Gosunkugi no Torakichi (Torakichi Long-Nail).

sen.j: 静岡で捕まってからは一旦東京の東京拘置所を経て、北海道の月形町集治監へ送られた。
sen.e: After he was captured in Shizuoka, he was detained for a while in Tokyo Detention House in Tokyo and then sent to Tsukigata-cho Shujikan (former type of state-run prison for the prisoners sentenced a severe punishment) in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 集治監→定訳不明： Tsukigata-cho Shujikan (a state-run prison for the prisoners sentenced a severe punishment, which existed during the Meiji period) としました。これ以降の「集治監」はShujikanとしました。月形町集治監→定訳不明： Tsukigata-cho Shujikan (a state-run prison for the prisoners sentenced a severe punishment, which existed during the Meiji period)
sen.e: After he was captured in Shizuoka, he was detained for a while in Tokyo Detention House in Tokyo and then sent to Tsukigata-cho Shujikan (Prison) in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 「集治監＝囚人を拘禁していた刑事施設の名称、後の監獄」ということと、shujikan (prison) という表記が多く見られますので、そのように修正しました。
sen.e: After he was captured in Shizuoka, he was detained for a while in Tokyo Detention House in Tokyo and then sent to Tsukigata-cho Shujikan (Prison) in Hokkaido.

sen.j: 樺戸では三度の脱獄の後、熊本県で捕まり、道内の三笠市集治監へ送られ、さらに道内の標茶町集治監に移された。
sen.e: After he committed three prison breakings in Kabato Shujikan (Hokkaido), he was captured in Kumamoto Prefecture (Kyushu) and he was firstly sent to Mikasa City Shujikan in Hokkaido, and later he was transferred to Shibecha Shujikan, which was also located in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 樺戸→Kabato Shujikan (Hokkaido) としました。三笠市集治監 →定訳不明： Mikasa City Shujikan としました。標茶集治監 →定訳不明： Shibecha Shujikan としました。
sen.e: After he committed three prison breaks in Kabato Shujikan (Hokkaido), he was captured in Kumamoto Prefecture and he was firstly sent to Mikasa City Shujikan in Hokkaido, and later he was transferred to Shibecha Shujikan, which was also located in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: breakings→breaks と修正しました。(Kyushu) を削除しました。
sen.e: After he committed three prison breaks in Kabato Shujikan (Hokkaido), he was captured in Kumamoto Prefecture and he was firstly sent to Mikasa City Shujikan in Hokkaido, and later he was transferred to Shibecha Shujikan, which was also located in Hokkaido.

sen.j: 明治23年（1890年）3月、標茶集治監が網走に引っ越して網走刑務所になるに伴い網走へ移った。
sen.e: In March 1890, when Shibecha Shujikan was moved to Abashiri and it became Abashiri Prison, he was also transferred.
In March 1890, when Shibecha Shujikan was moved to Abashiri and it became Abashiri Prison, he was also transferred.
In March 1890, when Shibecha Shujikan was moved to Abashiri and it became Abashiri Prison, he was also transferred.

sen.j: 最初の殺人未遂や放火に加えて脱獄した道中で起こした様々な犯罪、それに脱獄そのものによって、西川は非常に永い刑期を持つに至った。
sen.e: As a result of various criminal acts he committed along the way of escape and prison breakings themselves, in addition to the attempted murder and fire-setting that he committed in the first crime, Nishikawa had to pay an enormously long prison term for him.

sen.j: が、空知に送られてからは良い看守に当たったこともあって一貫して模範囚であり、最後には刑務所の敷地内を自由に移動できるほど信頼の置かれた状況となった。
sen.e: However, since he was transferred to Sorachi (Asahikawa, Hokkaido), thanks to the encounter with a good prison guard and other factors, he had been consistently an exemplary prisoner, and finally he was so highly trusted that he enjoyed entire freedom of movement on the premises of the prison.

However, after he was transferred to Sorachi (Asahikawa, Hokkaido), due to the encounter with a good prison guard and other factors, he was consistently an exemplary prisoner, and finally he became so highly trusted that he enjoyed entire freedom of movement on the premises of the prison.

sen.e: However, after he was transferred to Sorachi (Asahikawa, Hokkaido), due to the encounter with a good prison guard and other factors, he was consistently an exemplary prisoner, and finally he became so highly trusted that he enjoyed entire freedom of movement on the premises of the prison.

sen.j: 大正13年（1924年）の9月3日、当時71歳という高齢を理由として、ついに網走刑務所を仮出所するに至った。
sen.e: On September 3, 1924, at last he was released on parole from Abashiri Prison for the reason of his old age of 71.
On September 3, 1924, at last he was released on parole from Abashiri Prison for the reason of his old age of 71.
On September 3, 1924, at last he was released on parole from Abashiri Prison for the reason of his old age of 71.

sen.j: 出所してからの西川はさまざまな興行師に利用されてその波乱万丈に満ちた生涯を語るなどして人気を博した。
sen.e: After the release, various showmen utilized Nishikawa in performances, in which he became popular, talking about his stormy life and others.

sen.j: 昭和の初期には故郷・三重県多気郡の息子に引き取られ、昭和16年（1941年）、安静にその生涯を終えた。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Showa period, his son living in his hometown in Taki-gun, Mie Prefecture took over him, and in 1941he ended his life peacefully
